revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: "From Nemesas and the associate sitologoi of the village of Philopator also called Theogenes. Itemized lists of transport charges on the wheat measured out (to us and taken) to the harbor of Kerke from Pauni of the 8th yr. to Hadrianos of the 9th yr. of Antoninus Caesar our lord, from the crop of the past 8th yr. as follows:;Pauni 22. Land of the temple of Hephaistos: Heron, son of Theabennis, 5 1/2 1/3 1/24 art. of wheat; for diaphoron 1/3 art. . . . of wheat.;Likewise, catoechic land at Karanis: Tauris, daughter of Chairemon, 6 1/2 1/12 1/24 art. of wheat; extra charge 1/2 1/24 . . .;Likewise, land of the temple of Hephaistos: Apol. . ., son of Orsenouphis, 5 art. of wheat; for diaphoron . . .;Public land at Karanis: Anch(), son of Onnophris, acting through Apol(), son of Orsenouphis, . . . art. of wheat.;Likewise, estate of Pallas: the same, acting through the same . . . art. of wheat.;Total for the day, 41 1/3 art. of wheat.;23rd, Public land at Karanis: . . ., son of Sabinus, 21 . . . art. of wheat.;Likewise, Petonopsios, son of Petonopsios, 7 1/2 1/12 . . . art. of wheat.;Catoechic land at Karanis; Didymos, son of Menelaos, 2 1/3 1/24 art. of wheat; extra charge 1/3 1/12 . . .;Total for the day, 17 1/4 art. of wheat."

listBibl.bibl: Youtie HC-Youtie LC, ZPE 33, 201-4, 1979, Pl Xc -- SB XVI 12564
